org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure

Class DefaultInfrastructureManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure.InfrastructureManager
      • org.ow2.proactive.resourcemanager.nodesource.infrastructure.DefaultInfrastructureManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, NodeSourcePlugin

    public class DefaultInfrastructureManager
extends InfrastructureManager
    A default infrastructure manager. Cannot perform the deployment but is able to register incoming nodes (existing nodes added by url) and remove them.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(Object... parameters)
        Adds information required to deploy nodes in the future. Do not initiate a real nodes deployment/acquisition as it's up to the policy. The runtime variables of an infrastructure should not be explicitly persisted in this method as the link with the node source is not properly set at the time of calling this method. They will be persisted at the end of the initialization in RMCore#createNodeSource
        Specified by:
        configure in class InfrastructureManager
        Parameters:
        parameters - of the infrastructure manager

      • acquireNode

        public void acquireNode()
        Asynchronous node acquisition request. Proactive node should be registered by calling InfrastructureManager.internalRegisterAcquiredNode(Node)
        Specified by:
        acquireNode in class InfrastructureManager

        public void acquireAllNodes()

        Specified by:
        acquireAllNodes in class InfrastructureManager

      • isThereNodesInSameJVM

        public boolean isThereNodesInSameJVM(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
        Check if there are any other nodes handled by the NodeSource in the same JVM of the node passed in parameter.
        Parameters:
        node - Node to check if there any other node of the NodeSource in the same JVM
        Returns:
        true there is another node in the node's JVM handled by the nodeSource, false otherwise.

      • notifyAcquiredNode

        public void notifyAcquiredNode(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
                        throws RMException
        Notifies the implementation of the infrastructure manager that a new node has been registered. If this method throws an exception, the node registration will be discarded. This method is always called if implementor doesn't use deploying nodes (no call to InfrastructureManager.addDeployingNode(String, String, String, long) was made), and is called only for deploying nodes for which one no timeout occurred.
        Specified by:
        notifyAcquiredNode in class InfrastructureManager
        Parameters:
        node - the newly registered node
        Throws:
        RMException - if the implementation does not approve the node acquisition request

      • notifyDownNode

        public void notifyDownNode(String nodeName,
                           String nodeUrl,
                           org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node proactiveProgrammingNode)
                    throws RMException
        Define what needs to be done in an infrastructure implementation when a node is detected as down.
        Specified by:
        notifyDownNode in class InfrastructureManager
        proactiveProgrammingNode - the ProActive Programming Node that is down.
        Throws:
        RMException - if any problems occurred.

      • onDownNodeReconnection

        public void onDownNodeReconnection(org.objectweb.proactive.core.node.Node node)
        Description copied from class: InfrastructureManager
        Called by the system every time a node that is DOWN reconnects and changes its status to FREE or BUSY.
        Overrides:
        onDownNodeReconnection in class InfrastructureManager
        Parameters:

      • removeDownNodePriorToNotify

        public void removeDownNodePriorToNotify(String nodeName)
        Description copied from class: InfrastructureManager
        This method can be overriden by subclasses, especially if they do not want the node to be removed from the InfrastructureManager map when detected as down.
        Overrides:

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Notify this infrastructure it is going to be shut down along with its nodesource. All necessary cleanup should be done here.
        Overrides:
        shutDown in class InfrastructureManager

      • initializePersistedInfraVariables

        protected void initializePersistedInfraVariables()
        Description copied from class: InfrastructureManager
        This method should initialize a value in the runtime variables map for all the runtime variables that will be used in the class. It is called at initialization time of the infrastructure, just before the InfrastructureManager.configure(Object...) method. This method runs with the write lock acquired.
        Specified by:
        initializePersistedInfraVariables in class InfrastructureManager
